item.title: 摩根士丹利在里拉汇率创下历史新高之际推出拥挤的里拉交易旗帜
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）建议对土耳其里拉采取更加谨慎的态度，理由是货币贬值速度加快，利差交易中的定位越来越拥挤，即使该货币继续产生实际正收益。【原文：Morgan Stanley is advising a more cautious approach to the Turkish lira, citing a faster pace of currency depreciation and increasingly crowded positioning in the carry trade, even as the currency continues to generate positive returns in real terms.】

item.title: 中国为抵消关税突击花钱，预算缺口创历史新高
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税减少了对美国的出口，中国上半年的预算赤字攀升至创纪录的新高，凸显了政府为支撑国内需求而加大的努力。【原文：China’s budget deficit climbed to a fresh record in the first half, highlighting intensified government efforts to shore up domestic demand as Donald Trump’s tariffs reduce exports to the US.】

item.title: 泰柬冲突对贸易和旅游业造成的风险暂时有限
item.description: 泰国和柬埔寨之间的武装军事冲突目前对大多数商业部门造成的风险有限，而旅游业专家正在采取观望态度以评估其影响。【原文：The armed military conflict between Thailand and Cambodia presents limited risks to most business sectors for now while tourism industry experts are taking a wait-and-see stance to assess the impact.】

item.title: 起亚重塑美国销售战略，因关税问题削减激励措施
item.description: 起亚公司将调整其在美国的业务运营，并削减针对零售客户的激励措施，与全球汽车制造商一道努力减轻美国总统唐纳德-特朗普征收进口关税的影响。【原文：Kia Corp. will adjust its business operations in the US and cut incentives for retail customers, joining carmakers globally in trying to mitigate the fallout of President Donald Trump’s import tariffs.】

item.title: 日本新闻应用程序运营商 SmartNews 据称将为 IPO 聘请银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本新闻聚合应用程序运营商 SmartNews Inc.【原文：Japan’s news aggregation app operator SmartNews Inc. has hired banks for its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国银行哈特内特再次警告股市存在泡沫风险
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的策略师表示，随着货币政策的放松以及金融监管的放松，股市出现泡沫的风险正在上升。【原文：The risk of a bubble in stock markets is rising as monetary policy loosens alongside an easing in financial regulation, according to Bank of America Corp. strategists.】

item.title: 汤姆-海耶斯获胜后，四名因操纵汇率入狱的交易商将提起上诉
item.description: 本周，英国最高法院推翻了对汤姆-海耶斯（Tom Hayes）的定罪，四名交易员将对他们因操纵基准利率而入狱的判决提出上诉。【原文：A group of four traders will appeal convictions that saw them jailed for fixing benchmark interest rates, after the UK Supreme Court overturned the conviction of Tom Hayes this week.】

item.title: 欧盟与美国向贸易协议迈进，德国商业前景趋于乐观
item.description: 第三季度伊始，德国企业的信心略有增强，因为欧洲和美国更接近于达成贸易协议，而且德国总理弗里德里希-梅尔兹（Friedrich Merz）誓言将经济作为其首要任务。【原文：Confidence among German businesses improved slightly at the start of third quarter as Europe and the US moved closer to a trade deal and Chancellor Friedrich Merz vowed to make the economy his No. 1 priority.】

item.description: 欧洲债券连续第三天下跌，原因是交易商继续减少对欧洲央行今年最后一次降息的押注。【原文：European bonds dropped for a third day as traders continued to reduce their bets on a final European Central Bank interest-rate cut this year.】

item.title: 奇货可居：木柴在美国经济史上失去的作用（播客）
item.description: 如今，电、煤气或取暖油等能源的成本已被视为一项重要的经济数据。但事实证明，在美国历史的大部分时间里，我们一直忽略了一个重要的经济数据：木柴的成本。几十年来，木柴一直是支撑美国经济的主要能源。然而，并没有关于木柴价格的官方统计数据。毕竟，你怎么能给生长在大自然中的木柴贴上价格标签呢？【原文：Today, the cost of energy — things like electricity, or gas, or heating oil — is considered an essential piece of economic data. But it turns out that for much of America’s history, we’ve been overlooking a crucial economic figure: the cost of firewood. For decades, firewood was the dominant energy source powering the US economy. And yet there aren’t really any official statistics about firewood prices. After all, how would you even go about putting a price tag on something that’s growing in a l】

item.title: 爱尔兰时报》称亚马逊因能源问题放弃在爱尔兰新建工厂
item.description: 据《爱尔兰时报》（Irish Times）报道，亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc）因无法确保项目的电力供应而取消了在都柏林建造一座工业厂房的计划。【原文：Amazon.com Inc scrapped plans to build an industrial plant in Dublin after failing to secure power supply for the project, according to the Irish Times.】

item.title: 中国公司本周在安哥拉达成第二笔农业交易
item.description: 中国中国水利水电建设集团将在安哥拉投资超过1亿美元，开发新的谷物进口来源—；这是本周两国达成的第二项农业相关交易。【原文：Sinohydro Group of China will invest more than $100 million in Angola to develop new sources of grain imports — the second agriculture-related deal agreed between the two countries this week.】

item.title: 南非客运铁路局与主要工会达成工资协议
item.description: 南非客运铁路局与其主要工会达成工资协议，工人工资将全面增长 5.5%。【原文：The Passenger Rail Agency of South Africa and its key union reached a wage agreement that will see a 5.5% increase in workers’ pay across the board.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利发行美国公司首只熊猫债券
item.description: 摩根士丹利成为首家进入中国熊猫债券市场的美国公司，发行了 20 亿元人民币（2.79 亿美元）的债券。【原文：Morgan Stanley has become the first American company to tap China’s panda bond market, with a 2 billion yuan ($279 million) offering.】

item.title: 热浪促进食品和饮料销售，英国零售销售反弹
item.description: 由于英国人沐浴在热浪中，6 月份英国零售额出现部分反弹，这进一步表明英国经济已从春季的连续月度萎缩中复苏。【原文：UK retail sales partially bounced back in June as Britons basked in heat wave conditions, adding to signs that the economy recovered from back-to-back monthly contractions during the spring.】

item.title: 据说日本央行认为今年存在潜在加息环境
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在美国和日本本周达成贸易协议后，日本央行官员认为今年有可能再次酝酿加息。【原文：Bank of Japan officials see the possibility of mulling another interest rate hike this year after the US and Japan struck a trade deal this week, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度央行行长表示，印度央行将继续把稳定物价放在首位
item.description: 印度央行行长桑杰-马尔霍特拉（Sanjay Malhotra）周五表示，印度央行将继续把稳定物价放在首位，同时促进亚洲第三大经济体的增长。【原文：India’s central bank will continue to prioritize stability in prices while boosting growth in Asia’s third largest economy, Governor Sanjay Malhotra said on Friday.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 6 月零售销售增长低于预期

item.description: 中国央行周五加大了注入流动性的力度，以阻止债券抛售，而债券抛售正引发螺旋式下跌的风险，这可能会破坏金融市场的稳定。【原文：China’s central bank ramped up its liquidity injection on Friday, moving to stem a bond selloff that’s raising the risk of a downward spiral which may destabilize financial markets.】

item.title: 罗马下一个大型旅游景点面临开业前倒闭的风险
item.description:

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克认为进一步降息的必要性不大
item.description: 管理委员会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，除非经济遭受重大打击，否则欧洲央行没有理由进一步降低利率。【原文：There’s little reason for the European Central Bank to lower interest rates further unless the economy suffers a major blow, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 越南股市因资金流入和贸易乐观情绪创历史新高
item.description: 由于对与美国达成贸易协议持乐观态度，外国资金重新流入越南，越南股市正创下历史新高。【原文：Vietnamese shares are heading for a record high, aided by the return of foreign fund inflows amid optimism about a trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 日本股市飙升引发 2024 年市场崩溃的回忆
item.description: 在美国贸易协议推动股市创下历史新高后，日本股市的反弹已使一些市场指标接近去年股市崩溃前的水平。【原文：The rally in Japanese stocks has pushed some market indicators close to levels struck ahead of last year’s meltdown, after a US trade deal propelled equities to a record.】

item.title: 俄罗斯日益严重的经济困境为进一步下调关键利率埋下伏笔
item.description: 在通胀放缓、官员和企业为避免经济陷入衰退而施加的压力越来越大的情况下，俄罗斯央行仍有进一步下调关键利率的空间。【原文：The Bank of Russia has room for a deeper cut to its key interest rate amid slowing inflation and growing pressure from officials and businesses to save the economy from sliding into recession.】
